entry.title: AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY BEGINS TUESDAY FOR MUCH OF REGION
entry.summary: January 6, 2025 3:50 a.m. An Air Stagnation Advisory is in effect from 10:00 a.m. Tuesday through 12:00 p.m. Friday for much of southern Oregon. Forecasters at the National Weather Service said strong valley inversions will result in weak winds, and poor mixing and ventilation. This will result in stagnant air conditions that will trap...

entry.title: WINSTON CITY COUNCIL WITH FIRST MEETING OF 2025 MONDAY NIGHT
entry.summary: January 6, 2025 3:40 a.m. The Winston City Council will have its first meeting of 2025 on Monday night. New Mayor Christie Glen-Knutson will be sworn in along with the incumbent councilors. A council president will be elected for the year. Councilors will hear several reports from staff along with a representative from Douglas High...

entry.title: PETERSON CAT OPENS IN ROSEBURG
entry.summary: January 6, 2025 3:30 a.m. In the KQEN Business Spotlight: Peterson Cat Roseburg is now open. entry.title: UCC COMPLETES FIRST PHASE OF STUDENT HOUSING RENOVATIONS
entry.summary: January 6, 2025 3:20 a.m. Umpqua Community College has completed the first phase of student housing renovations on Southeast Jackson Street in downtown Roseburg. A UCC release said twenty-nine students have moved into new accommodations, located in the former Newberry’s department store. The building had been the offices of Redeemer’s Fellowship for over two decades....

entry.title: WILD SPRING CHINOOK HARVEST PROHIBITED ON MAINSTEM RIVER
entry.summary: January 6, 2025 3:05 a.m. On Friday, the Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife announced that a temporary rule will prohibit wild spring Chinook salmon harvest on the mainstem Umpqua River and reduce the North Umpqua bag limit. An ODFW release said from February 1st through June 30th: *Only hatchery spring Chinook may be kept...

entry.title: CHRISTMAS TREE RECYCLING WRAPS UP MONDAY
entry.summary: January 6, 2025 2:50 a.m. Roseburg Disposal is wrapping up its Christmas tree recycling program Monday. Trees can be dropped off at several locations around the community. entry.title: SINGLE VEHICLE CRASH CLAIMS LIFE OF ROSEBURG MAN

Undersheriff Brad O’Dell said around 8:00 p.m. dispatchers received a report of the crash on Lookingglass Road near Happy Valley Road. entry.title: Train trestle collapses in Corvallis, sending urea-laden railcars into the Mary's River
entry.summary: Corvallis Police and Fire crews responded to a train trestle collapse near Avery Park on Saturday afternoon. “Preliminary investigations indicate the trestle gave way while a freight train was passing over it. Currently, no injuries have been reported, but the scene remains active and under investigation,” Corvallis Police

entry.summary: January 4, 2024 6:30 a.m. On Friday the Oregon Parks and Recreation Department closed Cape Arago and Shore Acres state parks to vehicle traffic after a landslide undercut a portion of Cape Arago Highway just south of the Sunset Park State Park on the central coast. entry.summary: January 4, 2024 6:00 a.m. A Winter Weather Advisory continues through 10:00 a.m. Saturday for mountain areas in parts of southern Oregon. entry.title: Thrive Umpqua's Community Well-Being Challenge returns in 2025
entry.summary: The third annual Community Well-Being Challenge, hosted by Thrive Umpqua, launches Jan. 18 and runs through Dec. 31, 2025. The challenge encourages residents to participate in activities promoting longevity and wellness, including free classes, events, and exploration opportunities organized by…

entry.title: Tommy Whiteside's "Nana's Piano" album release party celebrates Oregon jazz
entry.summary: Roseburg-raised musician Tommy Whiteside is set to debut his jazz album, Nana’s Piano, at a special release party on Saturday, January 4, 2025, at the Rosebud Theatre in downtown Roseburg. This marks the completion of a deeply personal project for…

entry.title: Douglas County to hold swearing-in ceremony for elected officials
entry.summary: The Douglas County Board of Commissioners will host a Swearing-in Ceremony for newly elected officials on Monday, Jan. 6, at 9 a.m. in Room 216 of the Douglas County Courthouse, located at 1036 SE Douglas Avenue, Roseburg, Oregon.

entry.title: SENATORS ANNOUNCE MAJOR DISASTER DECLARATION FOR 5 COUNTIES
